page.title: 10SKELMERSDALE - RIVER TAWD
page.content: The River Tawd flows through the town of Skelmersdale. From its source at Billinge it follows a winding and sometimes underground course till it joins the River Douglas near Parbold, which then flows out to the sea at Hesketh Bank. Sadly it is a very polluted river and the Douglas into which it flows is also dead. Various attempts have been made to find the main industrial and domestic sources of this pollution and it is hoped that it might again become a clean river supporting fish and other wild life on its banks which form a fine ammenity for the town. Nearer to its confluence with the Douglas it flows through the Merseyside Scouts permanent Camp Site adding greatly to the interest of this youth facility.
